summary: The journey of our Madrid Founders in a new country is as personal as it is professional.  Read their stories that highlight the emotional and practical challenges of adapting to new cultural environments
title: Madrid update: Our first weeks as Founders

summary:
A list of 30 items you can hunt for while exploring the local area in which you live. 
The post A scavenger hunt in your neighborhood appeared first on rscottjones.
title: A scavenger hunt in your neighborhood

summary: 13 things I love about my dachshund, Cocoa for her 13th birthday
title: Cocoa turns 13 today

summary: Next allows you to do server-side data-fetching, but what happens when that data needs to change on the client.  This brief tutorial shows how to re-fetch the props without doing a full server reload
title: Refreshing Server-Side Props

summary: The z-index property can be a tricky little bugger.  Sometimes, no matter how much you crank up the number, the element never rises to the top.  In this article, we explore stacking contexts, and see how they can thwart our efforts to use z-index...
title: What The Heck, z-index??

summary: I have a set of baseline CSS styles that come with me from project to project.  In the past, I'd use a typical CSS reset, but times have changed, and I believe I have a better set of global styles
title: A Modern CSS Reset

summary: As front-end developers, we often learn CSS by focusing on individual properties.  Instead, we should focus on how the language uses those properties to calculate layouts.  In this blog post, we'll pop the hood on CSS and see how the language is structured, and how to learn it effectively
title: Understanding Layout Algorithms

summary: Certain layouts are surprisingly dastardly.  On the modern web, one of the most common layouts is also one of the trickiest.  In this tutorial, I break down how to build the "full-bleed" layout using CSS Grid
title: Full-Bleed Layout Using CSS Grid

summary: “Should I use pixels or rems. ”.  In this comprehensive blog post, we'll answer this question once and for all...
title: The Surprising Truth About Pixels and Accessibility

summary: Large language models like GPT-4 are becoming increasingly capable, at an alarming rate.  Within a couple of years, we won't need developers any more.  …Or at least, that's the narrative going viral on Twitter...
title: The End of Front-End Development
